Speaker: antiope
Dialogue: I pray a day will never come where she has to fight, but you, the wisest of us all, know that one cannot deny their inner nature. A scorpion must sting, a wolf must hunt --

Speaker: hippolyta

Speaker: hippolyta
Dialogue: It's time to sleep.

Speaker: hippolyta

Speaker: hippolyta
Dialogue: Diana... You are the most precious thing in this world to me. So much so, I sculpted you from clay and begged Zeus to give you life.

Speaker: hippolyta
Dialogue: Then I will tell you a new one. One of our people, and my days of battle...

Speaker: hippolyta
Dialogue: So you will finally understand... why war is nothing to hope for.

Speaker: hippolyta
Dialogue: Long ago, when time was new, and all of history was still a dream... the gods ruled the Earth, Zeus king among them.

Speaker: hippolyta
Dialogue: We give thanks to the gods for this paradise.

Speaker: hippolyta
Dialogue: The Godkiller?

Speaker: hippolyta
Dialogue: This is where we keep all the gifts the gods have given us.

Speaker: hippolyta
Dialogue: I pray there will never come a time when it is called to arms. But only the fiercest among us even could... And that is not you, Diana. She takes Diana's hand away from the sword.

Speaker: hippolyta
Dialogue: So you see, my daughter, you are safe. And it is nothing for you to concern yourself with.

Speaker: hippolyta

Speaker: hippolyta

Speaker: antiope

Dialogue: FOLLOWING GENERAL LUDENDORFF as he and his troops enter a large, nondescript WAREHOUSE.  STEVE  I posed as one of their pilots, then flew in with them.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Dammit.

Speaker: steve

Speaker: hippolyta

Speaker: hippolyta

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Themyscira has seen death for the first time, Mother. Ares must not be allowed to threaten us again. We know only too well what happens if he finds us -- and he will. Never again shall we be enslaved. And now mankind must be freed. As Amazons this is our duty!

Speaker: hippolyta
Dialogue: You are not an Amazon like the rest of us, Diana.

Speaker: hippolyta
Dialogue: You don't know war like we do.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Didn't hear you come in./Didn't hear you knock.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Would you say you're a typical example of your sex?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I like to think of myself as... above average.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: What is that?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: It's a watch.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: A watch.  31. 38   CONTINUED:                                                    38

Dialogue: Why?

Dialogue: Because it tells time.  So, I know when to wake up, work, eat, sleep.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You let this little thing tell you what to do?

Dialogue: What is this place?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Funny, because I understand even less now than before you walked in.

Speaker: steve

Speaker: diana

Speaker: diana

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Then there's nothing to be afraid of.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: What?

Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: hippolyta

Speaker: hippolyta
Dialogue: This belonged to the greatest warrior in our history -- make sure you are worthy of it.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I will.

Speaker: hippolyta
Dialogue: Be careful in the world of men, Diana, they do not deserve you.

Speaker: hippolyta
Dialogue: You have been my greatest love. Today you are my greatest sorrow.

Dialogue: Should you have told her?

Dialogue: The war? Well, which part? The Eastern Front in France is 400 miles long -- from the Alps to the Atlantic. Then there's the Dolomites in Italy, Turks in Arabia -- there used to be a Russian Front but they quit last year so they could kill the Tzar and have a revolution.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Where the fighting is the most intense then. If you take me there, I am sure I will find who I'm looking for.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Who's that?

Speaker: steve

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You're looking at the person who can. And after I find and destroy Ares, the German armies will be freed from his influence -- and they will be good men again.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: How much do you really know about the rest of the world?

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: The world of men? I know all there is to know about them -- from the great books.

Dialogue: The great books. Those books explain why there are no men on that island? Or kids?

Speaker: diana

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Just you?  Sheltered upbringing.

Speaker: diana

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Oh. Well, that's not how babies are made where I come from.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You refer to reproductive biology.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I refer to more than that. DIANA Ah.    The pleasures of the flesh.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: You know about that?

Dialogue: Of course. I've read all twelve volumes of Clio's Treatises on Bodily Pleasure. STEVE All twelve, huh?  You bring any of them with you?

Dialogue: You have until tonight, Captain.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Sir, the men have had no food.   No sleep.

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: Do you think I've had food or rest, Captain? Do you hear me making excuses? Your men are weak. Complacent. You've spoiled them. You've let them forget that an attack can come at any time -- from any quarter -- so let's you and I remind them, shall we?

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: Doctor.   Are you making progress?

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: We will get your book. But I believe in you, not it. I KNOW that you CAN and you WILL succeed.  It is what you were put on this Earth to do.

Dialogue: And make you into the god you are.

Speaker: maru

Dialogue: And our war will swallow this world... Forever.

Speaker: diana

Dialogue: What is a secretary?

Dialogue: Where I'm from, that's called slavery.

Speaker: etta
Dialogue: We've got our work cut out for us.

Dialogue: Is this what passes for armor in your country?

Speaker: etta

Dialogue: Oh, my! Aren't you terribly cold out here where everyone can see... everything? Let's get you into a nice, warm, private dressing room, shall we?

Dialogue: How can a woman possibly fight in this?

Speaker: etta
Dialogue: We fight with our principles. It's how we got the vote.

Speaker: etta
Dialogue: Not that I'm opposed to engaging in a bit of fisticuffs when the situation calls for it, mind you!

Speaker: etta
Dialogue: There we are.    Very nice.

Speaker: diana

Dialogue: I can't say that I blame it.

Dialogue: Where is she?

Speaker: etta
Dialogue: Trying on outfit number two hundred and twenty-six.

Dialogue: Quite a reception.

Dialogue: How'd you do that?

Dialogue: He's dead.

Dialogue: Colonel!

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Phillip! Phil!

Speaker: sir patrick
Dialogue: Our only aim at this moment -- must be to achieve peace at any cost.

Speaker: sir patrick
Dialogue: Gentlemen, I beg you, please, if you'll just hear me out --

Dialogue: Why will they not let him speak? He's talking peace.

Dialogue: That's why they won't let him speak.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: But if they want to stop the war, isn't that foolish?  Are they fools?

Dialogue: I'm sorry, sir, but the intel I've brought back is very time sensitive. We were attacked by men looking for it on the way here. One of Maru's notebooks.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: We need to get it to Cryptography. And I need an immediate audience with the Generals --

Speaker: colonel darnell
Dialogue: You don't just rush in here, like this, and demand an audience with the cabinet. Cryptography takes time and --

Dialogue: I'd heard you were lost on one of your missions, yet here you are. And you've brought a friend.

Speaker: colonel darnell
Dialogue: Our deepest apologies for the interruption, sir --

Speaker: sir patrick
Dialogue: Nonsense.  Sir Patrick Morgan, at your service.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Diana, Princess of --

Dialogue: Prince, Diana Prince. We... she and I... we work together. She helped me get this notebook here. From Maru's lab --

Dialogue: Cryptographers had no luck. It seems like a mixture of two languages.

Dialogue: Surely someone else in this room knew that.

Dialogue: Mustard gas. Hydrogen-based, instead of sulfur.

Dialogue: Gas masks would be useless against hydrogen.

Dialogue: The book says they plan to release this gas at... the front...  Front of what?

Dialogue: General, you have to find out where they're making this gas. Burn it to the ground. Destroy it.

Dialogue: Ludendorff was last seen in Belgium --

Dialogue: We can't be seen sending troops into German-occupied Belgium when we're negotiating their surrender.

Dialogue: Sir, I saw   this gas with my own eyes. All    the men on the front line could   die on both sides unless you   --

Dialogue: What? Would you have us abandon the front altogether?

Dialogue: Pull the troops out. Send me in. With some strategic support, I could take Ludendorff and his operation out myself.

Dialogue: Are you insane, Trevor? I can't introduce rogue elements this late into the game. STEVE But, General --

Dialogue: You will do nothing, Captain Trevor. That's an order.

Dialogue: Yes, sir.    I understand, sir.

Dialogue: I don't.

Speaker: diana

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Diana, wait!  59. 62   CONTINUED:                                                    62

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Sammy.    Please.

Speaker: diana

Dialogue: [I know Chinese, too, tricky girl.]

Dialogue: [But can you recite Socrates in Ancient Greek?]

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: That's not Charlie.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: That's Charlie. The two GRUNT at one another in Scottish slang, but the Bruiser sees Charlie's got friends -- and quickly leaves. The surprisingly cheerful CHARLIE  gets to his feet.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Steven. May God put a flower on your head.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: What were you fighting about?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I mistook his drink for mine.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: This man is no fighter.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Charlie here's an expert marksman.  He shoots people.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: From very far away.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: They never know what hit `em.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: How do you know who you kill if you can't see their face?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I don't.   Better that way.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: My aunt warned me about men like you.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Ain't the first time I heard that, lassie.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You fight without honor.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Don't get paid for honor.

Dialogue: What's the job, Trevor?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Two days tops. We need supplies and passage to Belgium --

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: What's the going rate?

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: Better be good pay.  [And perhaps a picture of your lovely face. Something to keep me alive.]

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: [You won't need a picture.   I'm coming with you.]

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: What is this?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: We're dropping her off at the front.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: Dropping her off?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: No offense, cherie, but I don't wanna get killed helping a girl out of a ditch, ya know what I mean?

Speaker: bruiser
Dialogue: You got your friends.  These are mine.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: I am both frightened and aroused.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: When aren't you?

Speaker: etta
Dialogue: Hello, all! Sorry, I'm late.   I got waylaid by --

Dialogue: Sir Patrick!

Dialogue: That's what I was going to mention.

Speaker: sir patrick
Dialogue: Sit, gentlemen. Please, sit.

Speaker: sir patrick
Dialogue: I assume you're here planning something that's either going to get you court-martialed or killed.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I assume you're here to stop us.

Speaker: sir patrick
Dialogue: No.  Not that I like any of this.  As one of your American authors, Thomas Paine, so eloquently put it, `I prefer peace. But if trouble must come let it come in my time, so that my children can live in peace.'

Speaker: sir patrick
Dialogue: Now nothing can jeopardize the armistice talks, but... I also believe in insurance. I'm here to help you. Unofficially, of course. What's your plan?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: If there is another weapons facility, find it and destroy it. Along with Ludendorff and Maru.

Speaker: sir patrick
Dialogue: Etta will run the mission out of my office, to allay suspicion.

Speaker: etta
Dialogue: Run the mission, sir?

Speaker: sir patrick
Dialogue: It's enough for a few days.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Thank you, sir.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: The gas, Ludendorff, Maru... You realize they are all symptoms. Ares is the disease. And once I find him, none of this will matter.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I'll take you to the front, but I can't make any promises about finding `your friend' any more than I can Santa Claus.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You won't need to. I'll know him when I see him.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Train leaves in a few minutes.

Dialogue: Hungry?

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: It's cold.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: It's ice cream.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: It's wonderful.  You should be very proud.

Speaker: steve

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Careful, I might get offended.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I wasn't referring to you.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I went undercover and pretended to be something else, I shot people on your beach, and I smuggled a notebook. Liar, murderer, smuggler.  You still coming?

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: The gas will kill everyone... everything.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: What kind of weapon kills innocents?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Chief!

Dialogue: It's good to see you.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Aye.

Dialogue: Who is this?

Dialogue: Niitangio, Napi.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I am Diana.

Dialogue: Where did you find her?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: She found me.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I plucked him from the sea --

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: It's a long story.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: British tea for the Germans. German beer for the British.  Edgar Rice Burroughs novels for both sides.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: And guns.

Speaker: the chief
Dialogue: It's not even very good beer.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Ludendorff was last seen at the front --  -- near the Somme. Front's about three miles away. Chief will get us there.

Speaker: the chief
Dialogue: Then it's another day to safely cross it.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: As soon as we have daylight, we move. I'll take first watch.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: No need. I'll take it.     I never sleep on the job!

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Strange thunder.

Speaker: the chief
Dialogue: German seventy-sevens.  That's the front out there. The evening hate.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: So... who do you fight for in this war?

Speaker: the chief
Dialogue: I don't fight.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You're here for profit then? THE CHIEF Nowhere better to be.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Nowhere better to be than a war you don't take a side in?

Speaker: the chief
Dialogue: I have nowhere else and no side left. The last war took everything from my people. We have nothing left. At least here, I'm free.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Who took that from your people? Chief cocks his head to the side.      How could she not know?

Speaker: the chief
Dialogue: His people.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You're safe.  What did you see?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I'm fine, `right?  Bloody broad.

Speaker: the chief
Dialogue: He sees ghosts.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: You're going to get cold.     Here.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: No, I'm --

Speaker: von hindenburg
Dialogue: You were absent at the council meeting, General.

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: You've begun negotiating the terms of the armistice.

Speaker: von hindenburg
Dialogue: On the Kaiser's behalf.

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: If only you had faith in me.

Speaker: von hindenburg
Dialogue: We don't. There are shortages of food, medicine, ammunition. Every hour we delay costs thousands of German lives.

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: One attack and the war is ours. As we speak, my chemist and her team are --

Speaker: von hindenburg
Dialogue: We stand against you and your witch, Ludendorff! Enough!  Twenty-four hours from now this war will end. It is over.

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: For all of you.

Speaker: maru
Dialogue: The mask won't help.

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: Yes, but they don't know that.  75. 73    CONTINUED:                                                   73

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: It's time to stage our demonstration for the Kaiser.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Those animals.     Why are they hurting them?

Dialogue: Because they need to move.    Like us.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: But I can help them!

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: There's no time! C'mon, woman.

Dialogue: Oh, God.   God, help me! Please.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: That man... He's injured.

Dialogue: There is nothing we can do about it, Diana. We must keep moving.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Where are we?

Dialogue: This is no man's land, Diana. It means no man can cross it. This is the worst point on the entire front. Speaker: diana
Dialogue: So we do nothing?

Dialogue: We are doing something. We can't save every person in this war. Besides, it's not what we came here to do.

Dialogue: DIANA, NO!!!

Dialogue: Bell tower.

Dialogue: Charlie!

Dialogue: It's too high.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: He doesn't charge them?

Dialogue: Money isn't the only profit.  Everyone's fighting their own battles, Diana. Just as you are fighting yours.

Dialogue: Found it.

Dialogue: Have you found Ludendorff's operation?

Dialogue: German High Command?

Dialogue: Actually, that gala's perfect cover --

Dialogue: Captain Trevor, you are under no circumstances to attend that gala tomorrow night. We cannot risk jeopardizing the Armistice.

Dialogue: You shouldn't be worried about upsetting the peace accord. Ares would never let that happen...

Dialogue: Ares?    You mean Ludendorff.

Dialogue: I forbid it.   Do you hear me? Steve?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I'm sorry, sir, you're breaking up.

Dialogue: Steve?   Are you there -- ?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Drinks later, Sameer. I need you to rustle up me a German uniform.

Dialogue: Already done. Now you two need to relax. There's nothing we can do until tomorrow. You said it yourself, Steve.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: It's bitter.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: It's an acquired taste.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: It has hints of different flavors, if you look for them.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: You did this.

Dialogue: We did.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: You have dancing on `Paradise' Island?

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Precisely.  Perhaps you'd better show me.

Speaker: steve

Dialogue: You're not going to the gala.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Of course, I am. Why wouldn't I?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Because you don't know how to dance, for one thing.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I would argue that they don't know how to dance.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You're awfully close.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: That's kinda the point.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Ah.    I see.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: It's a snowfall.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: It's magical.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: You're right.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Is this what people do when there are no wars to fight?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: This and other things.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: What things?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I don't know.    They... make breakfast.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: What else?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Read the newspaper. Go to work --  They... get married. Maybe have babies, grow old together.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: What is it like?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: No idea.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Maybe... once I defeat Ares and war ends forever... there will be time to learn about... all kinds of things.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: God, I hope you're right.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: The villagers gave them to us.

Speaker: the chief
Dialogue: A gracious gift.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: They called us heroes.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You are.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Guys, I'm fully aware that I said this job was two days --

Speaker: the chief
Dialogue: You would get lost without us.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: Yeah, we know Diana's capable of looking after herself, but I'm worried you wouldn't make it. STEVE There's no more money, boys.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: We've been paid enough. The Chief nods, but Diana spots Charlie's hesitation.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: If you're coming, Charlie, perhaps you'll sing more for us.  I enjoyed it very much.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: Ah!   Don't encourage him!

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: That's the craziest story I ever heard!

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: Wait. There's a whole island of women like her? And not a single man among them?  How do we get there?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: You're not their type.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: You're all going daft.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: It's true... every word.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: And she thinks Ludendorff is Ares? The God of War? CHARLIE And only by killing him will the war end?

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: You saw what she did out there. The way she charged that machine gun nest. The way she took out that tower. Maybe it's true!

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: You don't really believe all this rubbish, do ye?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: How the hell are we gonna get in?

Speaker: the chief
Dialogue: The way in is through the gate.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Thank you, Chief, for that ancient tribal wisdom, that's very helpful.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: If you could get through the gate I only see one guard at the door to distract.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: It won't look at all suspicious when I come sauntering out of the woods on foot --

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I could get in.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: You're not going in.     It's too --

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Dangerous?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I know how to do stealth -- been doing it my whole life. I'll follow them to wherever they're working on the gas or better yet find out where it is.  Plus, we can't make a scene.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I can be stealthy.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Diana, what you're wearing doesn't exactly qualify as `undercover.'

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: I don't know, I'd say she was pretty under covered.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: There's no way to get you in. Let me scout it and report back. Worse case, we follow Ludendorff when he leaves and you can use that magic lasso of yours to get him to tell us where it is.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: But as long as he's still alive --

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: You can't go into German High Command and kill anyone! You have to trust me, Diana.

Dialogue: Field over there is full of them.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: Can I drive it? Lemme drive it. I'll be your chauffeur!

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Diana. Please, stay put.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: We should scout the area. In case we need to beat a hasty retreat. What do you think, Diana?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Uh-oh.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: Steve...

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: ... they have invitations.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: Dhanyavaad, Sahib. The Colonel and I wish many blessings and all manner of other things to fall upon your head --

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: And your head's empty! He wants my invitation, you idiot!

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: I must apologize a thousand thousand times, my masters, for my most horrid, wretched, and unworthy soul has lost the Colonel's invitation!

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: Blessings be upon us.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Keep the car running, Sahib.   And no joy riding.

Speaker: fausta
Dialogue: I am not spending the entire evening out here, you idiots. Move your cars! I said, move!

Speaker: fausta
Dialogue: What are you supposed to be?!    Ha! Out of my way.

Speaker: fausta
Dialogue: What are you doing?  Guards -- ?!

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: That was... fun.

Speaker: maru
Dialogue: They're starting to ask where Von Hindenburg and the others are.

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: Soon it won't matter.

Speaker: maru
Dialogue: But, General --

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: We continue as planned. Now go. I have people to tend to beyond you.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Excuse me.

Speaker: maru
Dialogue: I don't drink.  Have we met?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: No, but I've been watching you. Following your career, I mean. You're Dr. Isabel Maru. The most talented chemist in the German Army. I'm a fan.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I hope I'm not crossing a line.    I hear you and General Ludendorff are very close.

Speaker: maru
Dialogue: We work well together, yes.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I'm sure he provides a great deal of support for you and your work, but having someone like me behind you -- I could provide a lot more.

Speaker: maru
Dialogue: And who are you?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: A man who would show you the appreciation a genius like yourself deserves.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I love fire, don't you? It's like a living act of entropy. The ultimate weapon of destruction, reminding us that, in the end, everything returns to the ash it once came from. There's something reassuring about it.  I see all of that in your eyes.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Perhaps you could show me what you're working on. I hear it's extraordinary.

Speaker: maru
Dialogue: I appreciate your interest in my work, but I am loyal to General Ludendorff. Besides, I see now your attention is elsewhere.

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: Enjoying the party?

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I confess, I'm not sure what we're celebrating.

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: A German victory, of course.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Victory?   When I hear peace is so close?

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: `Peace is only an armistice in an endless war.'

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Thucydides.

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: You know your Ancient Greeks. They understood that war is a god. One that requires human sacrifice. Her heart pounds.

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: And in exchange, war gives man purpose. A chance to rise above his petty, mortal little life and be better than he is.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Only one of the many gods believed in that... and he was wrong.

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: You know nothing about the gods --

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: My apologies. You'll excuse me.  Enjoy the fireworks.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: You agreed to wait.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You agree to do things all the time then don't do them. Let me go --

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: You can't kill Ludendorff inside German High Command. The Armistice won't be signed. DIANA It won't matter --

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: What if you're wrong, Diana?    What if there is no Ares?

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You don't believe me.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I can't let you do this.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: What I do isn't up to you.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Diana!

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: The gas.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: The village.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: They're cheering.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: Diana!

Speaker: the chief
Dialogue: What did they fire?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: It was Ludendorff.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I see him.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Wherever he goes you follow him.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: How will you find us?!

Speaker: the chief
Dialogue: I know how.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: No.   Oh, no, no, no.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: They're dead. They're all dead.  YOU DID THIS!

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Diana, I'm sorry --

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You stopped me from killing Ares when I had the chance. You murderer! You killed these people!

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: No, I --

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: STAY AWAY FROM ME!

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Everything you've said to me is a lie.  But I see the truth now. It isn't just the Germans that Ares has corrupted. It's you, too. It's all of you.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I will find Ares and I will kill him.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: It's a signal from The Chief. They followed Ludendorff --

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Diana?!

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: Nice to see you again. This is a surprise.

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: But I have things to do.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You know why I'm here. I am Diana of Themyscira, daughter of Hippolyta.

Speaker: ludendorff
Dialogue: As magnificent a creature as you are, you are no match for me.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: We'll see about that.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I, daughter of Hippolyta, came here to complete the mission of the Amazons by taking your life, and ridding mankind and my people of you -- forever!

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Diana?

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I killed him. I killed Ares but nothing stopped. You kill the God of War, you stop the war.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Right... Then we've got to do something about it.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: No! Steve. All of this should have stopped. The fighting. It should have stopped. So why are they doing this?!

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Diana, I'm sorry... I know you thought -- I hoped it, too -- but I knew --

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You knew what?!

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: That it might not be that simple.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: But Ares is dead. They don't have to do this anymore. So why would they?!                                              101

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Because maybe people aren't... just good, Diana. Ares or no Ares. Maybe it's... just them.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: No... It can't be... Everything I saw? They were killing each other. Killing people they can't even see... Killing children. Like it was nothing... It had to be him!! It can't be them!

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Diana, sometimes people are complicated --

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: My mother was right. She said `the world of men don't deserve you.'  That's why she left. They don't deserve our help.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: It's not about whether they deserve it or not. It's about what you believe. You think I don't get it? All I've seen out there? I wish I could tell you that there was one `bad guy' to blame. Maybe we're all to blame. But that doesn't mean we shouldn't try to do better.  And if you believe this war should stop, Diana, if you want to stop it, then help me stop it. Now.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: If we don't, they're going to kill thousands more.  Don't give up on them.   Don't give up on me.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Please. We gotta go...  I have to.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: Where's Diana?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: We're on our own.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Steve?

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Who's there?  What are you doing?

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Sir Patrick?

Speaker: sir patrick
Dialogue: You're right, Diana. They don't deserve our help.  They only deserve destruction.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You're him. You.

Speaker: sir patrick
Dialogue: I am. But I'm not what you thought I was. You blame me, but the truth is...  ... all of this -- I did none of it.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I can't see where they're taking the gas.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: Wherever Diana is, I think we're gonna need her.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I am Diana of Themyscira, daughter of Hippolyta... and I am here to complete her mission --

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: The Godkiller...

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You lie!

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I compel you to tell me the truth!

Speaker: ares
Dialogue: I am.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: No... No, I'd never be a part of that.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Hurry up!    They're onto us!

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Sammy, let's go!

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: What are we going to do?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: There's not much we can do... if that's what I think it is.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: But we can stop that plane.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: If we radio ahead? We can ask Air Corps to shoot her down.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: No, if it crashes, it'll wipe out everyone for fifty square miles. We gotta ground it.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: Bad news. It's on a timer.    If we ground it here, same thing.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Is it flammable, Chief?

Speaker: the chief
Dialogue: Yeah, she said it was hydrogen? It's flammable.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I need you guys to clear me a path to that plane.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: No, Steve!

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: Steve!

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: the chief
Dialogue: Don't shoot!     The whole thing could go!

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Steve!

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I have the plane.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: But, Steve --

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: You destroy the lab!       Go!

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: If we go in there, we're not coming back.

Speaker: another angle
Dialogue: Ares charges Diana -- he conjures a SPEAR, throwing it at Diana. She blocks it, but again is thrown back as the weapon combusts -- slamming into a TRAIN CAR.  Ares does not relent, conjuring TWIN SWORDS -- swinging them at her -- she dodges the blades, BLOCKS them with her bracelets --

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: You hit that, we all go up. The co-pilot nods, puts his gun away -- spots another weapon. The co-pilot rips a FIRE HATCHET off the wall, swinging it hard. Steve dodges the hatchet -- then slams his fist into the co-pilot, sending him back against the GAS BOMBS --

Speaker: another angle
Dialogue: Ares conjures a LARGE SWORD, stabbing the roof, stopping himself.  Ares launches at Diana, grabbing her by the neck, lifting her into the air off the hangar.  SIR PATRICK/ARES Is that all you have to offer me?

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Steve...

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Steve...

Speaker: sir patrick
Dialogue: You came here with such hope and determination and look at you now. Mankind did this to you. Join me in the fight... and we can destroy them forever!

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Diana!   I have to go.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: What are you saying? Steve, whatever it is, I can do it.   Let me do it --

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: No. It has to be me. I can save today, you can save the world.  I wish we had more time.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I love you.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You're wrong about them...

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: They're everything you say, but so much more.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: It's not about deserve...

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: It's about what you believe... and I believe in love --

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Good-bye, brother.

Speaker: etta
Dialogue: You saved everyone.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Steve did that.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Did Etta tell you? That General whats-his-name, you know --

Speaker: etta
Dialogue: Haig.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: He only went and made us all spies! Oops. We're off to Petrograd! Oops.

Speaker: etta
Dialogue: There's a revolution going on. Even Chief's coming. You should, too.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I don't think so.

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: Behind all beauty, all wisdom, there is pain. You must take your pain and make it beautiful.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Where did you read that?

Speaker: sameer
Dialogue: I didn't.  You taught us that.

Speaker: venelia
Dialogue: My Queen --

Speaker: hippolyta
Dialogue: I know.    The Mother Box... it has awoken.    Alert everyone.
